newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: LITHUANIAN LITIMPEKS MAY SELL TO HOIUPANK.
newsitem.headline: LITHUANIAN LITIMPEKS MAY SELL TO HOIUPANK.

text.p: Lithuanian commercial bank Litimpeks said on Wednesday that the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) considered Estonia's Hoiupank as a suitable strategic investor.

Litimpeks chairman Gintautas Preidys told Reuters that all decisions on selling a stake to Hoiupank, including whether it would be a majority stake, would be taken only after the Litimpeks general shareholder meeting on March 27.
Litimpeks was one of the two banks shut during a bank crisis at the end of 1995 but was allowed to reopen last year.
It has been seeking investors to improve its operations and give it the capital boost it needs to compete in the Lithuanian market.
Hoiupank would be the latest Estonian bank to move into other Baltic markets after Hansapank bought a Latvian bank and Tallinna Pank purchased a stake in Latvia's Saules Bank.
